item.title: Report X-2024021587
item.description:
Report X-2024021587

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-04T15:11:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-21
  • City: UNIONDALE
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: AT THE UPS FACILITY IN NASSAU, NEW YORK, SMOKE WAS OBSERVED EMITTING FROM A ONE POUND FIBERBOARD BOX. EMPLOYEES WERE EVACUATED FROM THE AREA AND THE PACKAGE WAS ISOLATED OUTSIDE. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS VISIBLE ON THE OUTER BOX. THERE IS AN APPLIED LABEL STATING "DO NOT THROW AWAY THIS BOX. PLEASE PLACE THE CAMERA BACK IN THIS BOX AFTER REMOVING IT FROM THE WALL". "KEPLER ANALYTICS" IS ALSO INDICATED ON ONE SIDE OF THE BOX. THE EVENT HAS CAUSED ONE SIDE OF THE BOX TO HAVE A BURN HOLE WITH SCORCH MARKS SURROUNDING. THERE ARE VISIBLE CHAR AND SCORTCH MARKS ON ANOTHER SIDE OF THE BOX. INSPECTION OF THE INNER CONTENT REVEALS SOME TYPE OF CAMERA WITH AN UNKNOWN BATTERY SOURCE THAT IS ALMOST ENTIRELY DESTROYED. PRIOR TO THE INCIDENT, THE PACKAGE WAS FLOWN ON UPS AIRCRAFT FROM FT LAUDERDALE (FLL) TO LOUISVILLE (SDF) TO NEW YORK (JFK). AS REQUIRED PER 171.15 A TELEPHONE NOTICE WAS MADE TO THE NATIONAL RESPONSE CENTER (NRC). REPORT NUMBER 1392059.

item.title: Report E-2024020530
item.description:
Report E-2024020530

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-01T18:14:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-21
  • City: ROCHESTER
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On February 21, 2024, five (5) 5-gallon pails of UN3265 had loose caps and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the impacted site. ES wiped up the released product with Simple Green and absorbent pads. Once crews confirmed none of the containers were damaged, they restacked and repalletized all jugs of UN3265 corrosive liquid for return to the Buffalo terminal. One (1) 35-gallon drum of spent absorbent pads, PPE, and any cleanup debris and one (1) 55-gallon containing the damaged containers were taken for transport back to the Buffalo terminal.

item.title: Report X-2024021139
item.description:
Report X-2024021139

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-29T18:14:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-11
  • City: SYRACUSE
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: QA WAS CALLED TO UNLOAD DOOR 1. A WET HAZMAT PACKAGE WAS IDENTIFIED UPON ARRIVAL TO LOCATION BY THE MANAGER DescribePack: UPON RECOVERY, VISUAL INSPECTION CONFIRMED ALL 4 CAPS HAD LOOSENED IN TRANSIT AND CONTENTS HAD LEAKED TO OUTER PACKAGE THROUGH ADDITONAL PLASTIC BAG DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE WAS CONTAINED IN SALVAGE DRUM, REPORTS FILED

item.title: Report X-2024021230
item.description:
Report X-2024021230

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-29T18:14:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-15
  • City: ELMSFORD
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: the pkg was found leaking/soiled. used the appropriate PPE to handle the pkg and place it in a salvage drum to prevent any further spilling. DescribePack: The package plastic container had a loose cap causing an internal spill. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: use absorbent material and placed leaking items in salvage drum to prevent further spilling.

item.title: Report X-2024021525
item.description:
Report X-2024021525

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-28T18:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-21
  • City: RENSSELAER
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: A package handler was unloading a trailer when they noticed that there was a wet spot on it and informed a manager who then alerted a hazmat team member. It was then placed inside a yellow drum and then placed in the hazmat cage sealed under ventilation. DescribePack: All four of the caps were loose on the products. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: the package was put in a yellow hazmat drum and put into the hazmat cage under ventilation

  • Description: SequenceEvent: found the package soiled as soon as it was offloaded from trailer, used proper PPE to handle pkg and places in a salvage drum to stop any further leaking if any. DescribePack: the glass container inside the package had a loose cap, causing it to spill out half of its contents DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: placed package in a salvage drum to mitigate further spilling if any.
